intro: Nonatelia sikkimensis, commonly known as the Sikkim nonatelia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at elevations between 1,500 and 3,000 meters. Its botanical features include hairy stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom during the spring season. It is often found in forests and shrublands, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
